intro: Leucopogon brevifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved heath, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes many shrubs and evergreens adapted to acidic soils. The plant features small, evergreen leaves that are typically narrow and leathery, providing a dense, bushy appearance. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, clustered in small inflorescences, and bloom in late spring to early summer. Leucopogon brevifolius thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks.
